channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17635] Add unit tests to CompactionTxnHandler and use PreparedStatements for queries
item.description: It is better for jdbc code that runs against the HMS database to use PreparedStatements. Convert CompactionTxnHandler queries to use PreparedStatement and add tests to TestCompactionTxnHandler to test these queries, and improve code coverage.
item.summary: Add unit tests to CompactionTxnHandler and use PreparedStatements for queries

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12889553 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

The test failures are not related to this change.

Please can I get a review from one of the maintainers of CompactionTxnHandler? I see gates ekoifman wzheng

There is a review board review here

Thanks

Why is it better to use PreparedStatements in cases where the query is only executed once? I buy it if you're preparing them and then storing them in a static cache somewhere, but since you're preparing them every time you run the query I don't see the advantage.

In CompactionTxnHandler, I don't think you want to remove the quoteString calls. Those are to make it so that table or column names that are a keyword or contain spaces, etc. still work. I don't think the PreparedStatement solves that.

Why the changes to CompactionTxnHandler but not TxnHandler?

Thanks gates for looking at the change

Why is it better to use PreparedStatements in cases where the query is only executed once? I buy it if you're preparing them and then storing them in a static cache somewhere, but since you're preparing them every time you run the query I don't see the advantage.

On a RDBMS like Oracle the optimization happens at prepare time. The query plan is cached and is reused then next time the same query is prepared. So there is some small perf advantage to using PreparedStatement.

In CompactionTxnHandler, I don't think you want to remove the quoteString calls. Those are to make it so that table or column names that are a keyword or contain spaces, etc. still work. I don't think the PreparedStatement solves that.

I did leave the quoteString calls around table names, I think I only removed the calls around parameters, which I believe is safe, another benefit of PreparedStatements.

Why the changes to CompactionTxnHandler but not TxnHandler?

I had to start somewhere
Do the reviewers need any other information? gates ekoifman wzheng
Assuming original reviewers are happy, can I maybe get a review from stakiar or vihangk1 ?
asherman can you create an RB for this? There seem to be some logic changes in addition to the migration to PreparedStatement - whats the nature of these changes?

There is already a review board review here
There should be no logic changes.

This jira is resolved and released with Hive 3.0 If you find an issue with it, please create a new jira.
